config.question: Which of the following nations did the Embargo Act affect the most?

answer_3.response: New Englanders considered the embargo lunacy. New England merchants were willing to take their chances on the high seas, but for reasons that few people understood, the president insisted that it was better to preserve ships from possible seizure than to make profits. Sailors and artisans were thrown out of work. The popular press maintained a constant howl of protest.
